alert.note: Alert for Green Lake; Marquette (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 13 at 2:20PM CDT until April 13 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Into Early This Evening... ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Possible Again Friday Afternoon Toward Central Wisconsin... .The Red Flag Warning remains in effect until 8 PM CDT this evening for all of southern Wisconsin. Very warm, breezy, and dry conditions will continue to support critical fire weather conditions during this period. Another round of critical fire weather conditions are possible toward central Wisconsin Friday afternoon, with elevated fire weather conditions elsewhere. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR ALL OF SOUTHERN WISCONSIN... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH EARLY FRIDAY EVENING... The Red Flag Warning remains in effect until 8 PM CDT this evening for all of southern Wisconsin. In addition, the National Weather Service in Milwaukee/Sullivan has issued a Fire Weather Watch for Marquette and Green Lake Counties, which is in effect from Friday morning through Friday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Marquette and Green Lake Counties. * TIMING...For the Red Flag Warning, until 8 PM CDT this evening. For The Fire Weather Watch, from 11 AM until 8 PM CDT Friday evening. * WINDS...For the Red Flag Warning, south to southwest 12 to 15 MPH with gusts up to 25 MPH. For the Fire Weather Watch, south winds 12 to 15 MPH with gusts up to 25 MPH. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...For the Red Flag Warning, as low as 15 to 25 percent. For the Fire Weather Watch, as low as 20 to 25 percent. * TEMPERATURES...For the Red Flag Warning, highs in the lower to middle 80s. For the Fire Weather Watch, highs in the lower 80s. * IMPACTS...Caution is advised when using outdoor fires and equipment that causes sparks. Make sure all outdoor fires are extinguished properly, and consult your local DNR office for possible burn bans.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
